name: objectify-params
description: VS Code extension to convert function parameters into objects.

editor/context.when: resourceExtname == .ts || resourceExtname == .js || resourceExtname == .tsx || resourceExtname == .jsx || resourceExtname == .vue || resourceExtname == .svelte || resourceExtname == .mjs || resourceExtname == .cjs || resourceExtname == .mts || resourceExtname == .cts

objectifyParams.include.description: Space-separated glob patterns of files to include when scanning (use common glob format).

objectifyParams.exclude.description: Space-separated glob patterns of files/folders to exclude when scanning.

objectifyParams.showPreviews.description: Show a preview dialog for every call conversion, including confirmed valid calls.

objectifyParams.highlightDelay.description: Time in milliseconds to show preview highlighting. Zero means no preview.

objectifyParams.objectVariable.markdownDescription: Optional variable name to receive the incoming params object. When set, the signature keeps this variable (no destructuring) and the body receives a `let { ... } = name;` statement inserted on the first line.

objectifyParams.preserveTypes.description: When false, replace the generated object parameter types with `any`, discarding the extracted TypeScript types.
